column4: How do I change my graphics driver in ubuntu 11.10 from vesa to intel? since ubuntu dont have xorg.conf? is it in grub.conf?
the old intel vid driver used to be i700, i800, etc.. and frankly u might b better off with VESA compared to those! :)
run a scan on the bus for your chipset
yes but settle down they are upset and may boot you
aw shucks. That's where you woulda gone if you had a Touchscreen. Sorry. :( I remembering the wrong spot.
does going to Additional Drivers do anything? Its empty u say?
Im personally curious as I hav boards that still run that use those chips.
it was running fine when I had 10
I had a sneaking suspicion! Switch down to Linux Mint 10 if you want My opinion.
it just installs MP3 and video and things for you automatically. Its shortcut and works same as ubuntu.
